paragraph: The Long March 8 is a 356-ton Chinese made medium-lift rocket that can carry up to 4.5 tons into sun-synchronous orbit. It is the latest version in the Long March satellite launcher series. The Long March 8 had its first successful launch on December 22, 2020 and placed five satellites into sun-synchronous orbit, which is about 700 kilometers high.
title: Long March 8

paragraph: In November 2020, senior Iranian nuclear scientist, Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, was killed when a roadside bomb halted his car and machine-gun fire hit his vehicle killing him. 63-year-old Fakhrizadeh was a general in the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps. He earned several advanced scientific degrees including a doctorate in physics and was a key member of the team developing nuclear weapons for Iran. He was the fifth key member of the Iranian nuclear weapons program to be killed since 2010. Iran accused Israel of the killings.
title: Mohsen Fakhrizadeh

paragraph: The Kumsong-3 is a North Korean anti-ship missile that was deployed in November 2020. This new missile is intended to protect North Koreaâ€™s surface ships and submarines from South Korean, American and Japanese warships. The Kumsong-3 was first revealed in 2014 and the first test firing took place in 2015 when one was launched from a patrol boat. The missiles travelled 240 kilometers.
title: Kumsong-3
